channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Autopsy will be conducted this week on remains found in Gabby Petito case
item.description: The case of missing Gabby Petito took a tragic turn Sunday when police found human remains during their search for her -- and officials are working to determine whether the discovery could answer questions regarding what happened to the 22-year-old.

item.title: Analysis: What social media doesn't show us about Gabby Petito's life
item.description: CNN's Michael Smerconish says new revelations about the negative effects of Instagram and social media made him think about the case of Gabby Petito, the 22-year-old who has not been heard from since going on a road trip with her fiance.

item.title: 8 people killed in shooting at Russian university
item.description: A shooting was reported at a university in Perm, Russia, according to RIA Novosti, the country's state-owned news agency.

item.title: Russia's ruling party poised to retain majority amid allegations of voter fraud
item.description: Russia's ruling party United Russia, which backs President Vladimir Putin, is on track to secure a majority following a three-day parliamentary election, early results suggest.

item.title: French ambassador to the US says they 'absolutely weren't informed' of submarine deal
item.description: France's ambassador to the United States reiterated in an interview Monday that the breakdown of the French-Australian submarine deal last week came as a surprise to Paris.

item.title: What does Nancy Pelosi think about the 'special relationship'? CNN asks
item.description: In an exclusive interview, Speaker of US House of Representatives Nancy Pelosi and Speaker of the British House of Commons Sir Lindsay Hoyle tell CNN's Bianca Nobilo that the transatlantic 'special relationship' is going strong.

item.title: Vaccine gap stokes super spreader fears ahead of UN's first post-Covid meeting
item.description: US fears that this week's annual world leader jamboree at the United Nations could spark a super spreader event will highlight the stark inequality of global access to Covid-19 vaccines — even as developed nations begin offering booster shots.

item.title: China and the US were both born from armed conflict. They're now polar opposites on gun control
item.description: Last week, a 47-year-old man stormed into a law firm in China's Wuhan city and shot dead a lawyer who he had "some disputes with," according to Chinese state media. He then stuffed his gun, just under 20 inches (50 centimeters) long, into a tennis racket bag and left.

item.title: This is what happens to all the rats when cities flood
item.description: In the wake of Hurricane Ida, the pummeling rain that hit cities up and down the East Coast at the start of September overwhelmed storm drains, poured into subway stations and filled basements like bathtubs. The devastating human toll is well known. Less clear is what happened to the denizens of those cities' subterranean depths: the rats.

item.title: 'We want justice,' say the family of 10 civilians killed in a US airstrike
item.description: Emal Ahmadi knew his brother Zamarai wasn't the ISIS-K facilitator that American officials portrayed him to be in the days after his death. Now, at last, the whole world knows that too.

item.title: Afghanistan's women judges are in hiding, fearing reprisal attacks from men they jailed
item.description: Tugging at the folds of the traditional hijab dress, two young sisters jostle and laugh to try to get their mother's attention as she fries onions on the stove.

item.title: CNN visits the site of botched US drone strike in Afghanistan
item.description: CNN's Nic Robertson goes to the site of the drone strike that killed 10 civilians, 7 of them children, in Afghanistan to speak to the family of the victims.

item.title: Why boycotting the Beijing Winter Olympics could backfire
item.description: With the Tokyo 2020 Olympics and Paralympics now over, attention is turning to next year's Winter Olympics in the Chinese capital Beijing.

item.title: More people died in Alabama during 2020 than were born as Covid-19 deaths continue rising in the US
item.description: Alabama had more people die last year during the onset of the Covid-19 pandemic than births, a top health official said, as the US continues to grapple with rising coronavirus cases and deaths.

item.title: Democrats' tax plan puts their fragile majority at risk
item.description: Back in July I pointed out that the Democrats' massive $3.5 trillion reconciliation spending plan put their fragile congressional majorities at risk. Since then, and to make matters worse, House Democratic leaders tied passage of this partisan reconciliation spending to the painstakingly negotiated bipartisan infrastructure bill passed by the Senate last month, which now awaits consideration by the House. In other words, the $1.2 trillion infrastructure bill, which is desperately needed and has broad bipartisan support, is being held hostage until the votes are secured to pass the partisan $3.5 trillion reconciliation bill.

item.title: Evergrande's debt crisis is wreaking havoc on Hong Kong's stock market
item.description: Evergrande's debt crisis is continuing to unsettle investors in Asia and raising concerns about whether a potential default by the troubled Chinese conglomerate could spill over to other parts of the economy.

item.title: Red carpet photos from the Emmy Awards
Sudeikis zings 'SNL' boss Lorne Michaels in Emmys speech
item.description: "Ted Lasso" captured four Emmys and Jason Sudeikis won his first career Emmy for his starring role in the show. During an awkward moment in his speech, Sudeikis attempted to thank his former boss, Lorne Michaels.

item.title: Netflix makes history at the Emmys
item.description: Netflix has a chance to make history at this year's Emmys, nabbing early prizes for "The Crown" while some comedy honors went to the star player on another streaming service, Apple TV+'s "Ted Lasso," giving the TV industry's main award a decidedly British flavor.

item.title: Manny Pacquiao says he will run for Philippine presidency in 2022
item.description: Boxing star Manny Pacquiao said on Sunday he will run for president of the Philippines next year, after railing against corruption in government and what he calls President Rodrigo Duterte's cozy relationship with China.

item.title: Volcano erupts on La Palma in Spain's Canary Islands
item.description: The Cumbre Vieja volcano in La Palma, one of Spain's Canary Islands, erupted Sunday, after several earthquakes were felt over the weekend.

item.title: Trevor Noah rebukes Sean Hannity's vaccination advice
item.description: CNN's Brian Stelter speaks with Renee DiResta, Research Manager at Stanford Internet Observatory, and Yael Eisenstat, Future of Democracy Fellow at the Berggruen Institute, about people at home doing their own research into the Covid-19 vaccines.

item.title: Scientists examine kids' unique immune systems as more fall victim to Covid
item.description: Eighteen months into the Covid-19 pandemic, with the Delta variant fueling a massive resurgence of disease, many hospitals are hitting a heartbreaking new low. They're now losing babies to the coronavirus.

item.title: French slackliner crosses the Seine from the Eiffel Tower in breathtaking stunt
item.description: Crowds lining the banks of the Seine and visiting the Eiffel Tower in Paris this weekend were treated to an unusual sight -- a slackliner charting an unusual path across the skies above their heads.

item.title: Fauci reacts to FDA recommendation on Covid-19 booster shots
item.description: Vaccine advisers to the US Food and Drug Administration declined to recommend the agency approve Covid-19 booster doses for everyone who got vaccinated six months ago or longer. However, they did recommend a more limited step: emergency use authorization for people 65 and older, and for people at high risk of severe infection. CNN's Jake Tapper discusses with Dr. Anthony Fauci.

item.title: The UN General Assembly is about to start. Here's what to watch for
item.description: Coronavirus be damned, the world's diplomats are back.

item.title: 'Imagine how good it could be': Northern Ireland women's footballers ready to seize their moment
item.description: Nadene Caldwell doesn't want to be called an underdog anymore.

item.title: Dad finally got the Covid-19 care he needed -- and changed dozens of skeptics' minds
item.description: Every breath Robby Walker takes is one that almost didn't happen.

item.title: CNN reporter shows rallygoer video of Jan. 6 attack. See his reaction
item.description: CNN reporter Shimon Prokupecz spoke to a rallygoer at a right-wing rally in support of the Capitol rioters about the January 6 attack.

item.title: Rare first-edition copy of US Constitution could fetch $20 million
item.description: An exceptionally rare first-edition printed copy of the US Constitution is going on sale in New York, with Sotheby's auction house expecting bids up to $20 million.

item.title: About the only job women can do for the Kabul government is clean female bathrooms, acting mayor says
item.description: Female employees in the Kabul city government have been told to stay home, and only women whose jobs cannot be done by men are allowed to come to work -- the latest restrictions imposed by the Taliban in Afghanistan.

item.title: The US military needs to do more than apologize for its deadly 'mistake' in Kabul
item.description: On August 29, a US drone strike killed 10 members of one family in Kabul. That same day, the Pentagon announced that the operation successfully targeted a suicide bomber affiliated with ISIS-K, who had allegedly filled a car with explosives as part of a suspected plan to attack the Hamid Karzai International Airport, where US troops raced to complete their evacuation operation a day before their deadline.

item.title: The mysterious sex lives of dinosaurs
item.description: Dinosaurs must have had sex to reproduce but how they did it -- with their neck frills, armored plates and tails tipped with spikes -- isn't exactly clear.

item.title: The Chinese version of TikTok is limiting kids to 40 minutes a day
item.description: The Chinese version of TikTok is introducing a "teenage mode" that will limit the amount of time children under the age of 14 spend on the short-form video app to 40 minutes a day.

item.title: Lionel Messi substituted on home debut as Paris Saint-Germain score late winner
item.description: Lionel Messi's home debut for Paris Saint-Germain was far from how he would have dreamt it, with the Argentine forward being substituted by Mauricio Pochettino in the second half as his side went in search of a winning goal against Lyon.

item.title: Pop Off: Summer celeb romances that are heading into fall
item.description: This week on "Pop Off," CNN reporter Lisa Respers France tells you which celeb summer romances are heading into fall, chats with the stars of "The Morning Show" and debates the merits of Mariah Carey's "Glitter." Subscribe to Lisa's "Pop Life Chronicles" newsletter here.

item.title: See the harvest moon shine in the night sky tonight, 2 days before the autumnal equinox
item.description: As the fall season approaches and colder temperatures set in, there's a silver lining to look up to -- literally -- as the harvest moon makes its debut on September 20, bringing plenty of bright moonlight.

item.title: Australia's Fraser Island officially restored to Aboriginal name K'Gari
item.description: Australia's Fraser Island is the latest destination to have its Aboriginal name restored.

item.title: Toyota's Tundra is going hybrid
item.description: Look out, Ford F-150: Another hybrid pickup truck is hitting the market.

item.title: See what Virgin Hyperloop could look like in the future
item.description: Virgin Hyperloop's aerodynamic pods could transport riders up to 670 mph. While the technology has a long road ahead of it, this is what the hyperloop could look like.

item.title: One of Asia's most prestigious universities is on the frontline of a battle for democracy
item.description: Students and lecturers at Hong Kong's most prestigious university returned from summer break this month to a very different institution.

item.title: Why storm chasing is 'akin to an addiction'
item.description: The disappointment is heavy.

item.title: Adele all but confirms Rich Paul is her boyfriend with new Instagram post
item.description: Rumors have been swirling for months about the status of Adele's relationship status, but now she is making it official on her Instagram account.

item.title: Notre Dame cathedral in Paris will reopen in 2024, five years after disastrous fire
item.description: The Notre Dame cathedral is on track to reopen to the public in 2024 as the cathedral has now been entirely secured, two years after the disastrous fire that destroyed large parts of the 850-year-old building.

item.title: The origins of Covid-19: Why the search for the source is vital
item.description: • Vaccine boosters for more people are on horizon, but unvaccinated remain biggest obstacle to curbing pandemic

item.title: The first country to begin a mass vaccination of kids as young as 2 years old
item.description: The Cuban children sat in a Havana hospital watching a brightly painted clown perform his earsplitting act. They were not there for the performance, but were waiting their turn to receive one of Cuba's homegrown Covid vaccines.

item.title: 3 people shot at a Pennsylvania baby shower after an argument over gifts, police say
item.description: Three people were shot and wounded at a baby shower in Pennsylvania Saturday evening after an argument over gifts, Lower Burrell Police Chief John Marhefka said in a press briefing.

item.title: Opinion: The words Trump can't bear to say
item.description: On November 7, 1962, Richard Nixon met with reporters to concede that he had lost his bid for governor of California -- and to grumble about the way the press covered his campaign. It was two years since he had lost his race for president against John F. Kennedy, and few thought Nixon would ever run for office again.

item.title: Chris Rock says he has Covid. 'Trust me you don't want this,' comedian tweets
item.description: Comedian and actor Chris Rock revealed Sunday that he has tested positive for Covid-19, and he is using the opportunity to urge others to get vaccinated against the virus.
